title: Welcome
text:
I am currently a student at SIT studying Applied Computing (Fintech). This website documents my projects, visualizations, and learning journey.








Focus: I am passionate about Statistics and Economics.
Goal: aspiring to become a Quant trader.

Check out my Project Page to see what I’ve been working on!

title: Project: Forex News Bot
text:
For this project, I developed the Tele-Forex-News-Bot, an automated tool designed to deliver real-time foreign exchange (Forex) news updates directly to users via Telegram.
The goal was to create a low-latency notification system that helps traders stay updated with market-moving news without constantly refreshing websites.

title: Project: Forex News Bot
text:
For this project, I developed the Tele-Forex-News-Bot, an automated tool designed to deliver real-time foreign exchange (Forex) news updates directly to users via Telegram.
The goal was to create a low-latency notification system that helps traders stay updated with market-moving news without constantly refreshing websites.

title: Project: Forex News Bot
text:
Technical Architecture
I built this application using a modern JavaScript stack and cloud deployment.

Runtime: Node.js
Platform: Telegram Bot API
Deployment: Render (Cloud Application Hosting)
Version Control: Git


Key Features

Automated Fetching: The bot scrapes/fetches financial news from configured sources.
Instant Notifications: Uses the Telegram API to push alerts immediately to the user’s device.
24/7 Uptime: Deployed on Render to ensure the service runs continuously in the background.

title: Project: Forex News Bot
text:
Development Challenges

“One of the main challenges was managing the deployment pipeline on Render to ensure the bot automatically restarted if it crashed.”

I resolved this by configuring the build commands correctly in the Render dashboard and implementing robust error handling in the Node.js scripts to catch API failures gracefully.

title: Project: Forex News Bot
text:
Future Improvements
I plan to add sentiment analysis to the news feeds, allowing the bot to tag news as “Bullish” or “Bearish” automatically.

title: Data Visualization
text:
As part of my personal fitness journey, I started collecting data on my daily nutritional intake. The graph below visualizes my caloric consumption over a typical week compared to my maintenance target.



Figure 1: Weekly Caloric Intake vs. Target Goal




The bar chart displays the total calories consumed (blue bars) for each day of the week, from Monday to Sunday. The red dashed line represents my daily caloric target of 2200 kcal. * X-axis: Days of the week. * Y-axis: Total Calories (kcal). * Data Source: Personal food logs recorded via MyFitnessPal.



The Story: I noticed my weight was fluctuating despite “feeling” like I was eating consistently. I decided to visualize the data to find the pattern. The visualization reveals a clear trend: I tend to under-eat on weekdays (Wednesday/Sunday) to “save” calories, but then over-consume significantly on Saturdays (2600 kcal), which disrupts my weekly average.
Rationale for Visualization Choices: * Bar Chart vs. Line Chart: I chose a bar chart because daily intake is a discrete total for that specific day, making it easier to compare the magnitude of each day against the others. * Target Line: Overlaying the red target line provides an immediate “benchmark” for the viewer to see which days were compliant (under/on target) and which were outliers. * Annotations: I added the exact numerical values on top of the bars so the viewer doesn’t have to guess the exact calorie count by looking at the Y-axis.



I used Python’s matplotlib library to generate this chart.
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

days = ['Mon', 'Tue', 'Wed', 'Thu', 'Fri', 'Sat', 'Sun']
intake = [2100, 2250, 1950, 2400, 2150, 2600, 1800]
target = [2200] * 7

plt.bar(days, intake, color='skyblue', label='Actual Intake')
plt.plot(days, target, color='red', linestyle='--', label='Target')
plt.title('Weekly Caloric Intake')
plt.legend()
plt.show()

title: Data Visualization
text:
Below is a visualization I created during my [Course Name] module.



Figure 1: Trends in X over Time




This graph visualizes the relationship between X and Y. I chose a line chart because it effectively demonstrates the trend over the 5-year period.



I removed gridlines to reduce clutter and highlighted the peak value in red to draw the viewer’s attention to the anomaly in 2023.

title: Reflection on GenAI
text:
I chose this tool because of its ability to generate clean Markdown syntax and structure website layouts quickly.



It assisted me in: * Structuring code: It provided the template for the _quarto.yml file. * Debugging: It explained why my images weren’t rendering correctly.



Beneficial: It saves time on boilerplate code. Challenging: Sometimes the specific syntax (like Quarto callouts) is outdated and requires manual checking.



I plan to use GenAI as a “pair programmer” to troubleshoot errors in my future coding modules.
